events.name: EU launches legal action against the UK over Northern Ireland protocol bill
events.wd_label: EU launches legal action against the UK over Northern Ireland protocol bill
events.wd_description: The European Union expressed anger over the UK's legislation overriding the post-Brexit arrangement for Northern Ireland and launched four legal cases against the UK government.
events.description: The European Union expressed anger over the UK's legislation overriding the post-Brexit arrangement for Northern Ireland and launched four legal cases against the UK government.

events.name: protocol bill approval
events.wd_description: The Northern Ireland protocol bill was approved at its third hearing in the House of Commons by 267 votes to 195 and will proceed to the House of Lords in the autumn.
events.description: The Northern Ireland protocol bill was approved at its third hearing in the House of Commons by 267 votes to 195 and will proceed to the House of Lords in the autumn.

events.name: EU legal action
events.wd_description: The European Union launched four legal cases against the UK government in response to the passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill.
events.description: The European Union launched four legal cases against the UK government in response to the passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill.

events.name: potential fines
events.wd_description: The EU court has the power to impose multimillion-euro fines on the UK, potentially leading to punitive action through Brexit deal mechanisms.
events.description: The EU court has the power to impose multimillion-euro fines on the UK, potentially leading to punitive action through Brexit deal mechanisms.

events.name: EU commission statement
events.wd_description: The European Commission stated that the legal action was partly due to the continued passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill, which goes against the spirit of collective solutions.
events.description: The European Commission stated that the legal action was partly due to the continued passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill, which goes against the spirit of collective solutions.

events.name: Ukraine President fires head of SBU and prosecutor general
events.wd_label: Ukraine President fires head of SBU and prosecutor general
events.wd_description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy abruptly fired the head of Ukraine's domestic security agency, the SBU, and the state prosecutor general due to numerous cases of collaboration with Russia by officials in their agencies.
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy abruptly fired the head of Ukraine's domestic security agency, the SBU, and the state prosecutor general due to numerous cases of collaboration with Russia by officials in their agencies.

events.name: sacking of Ivan Bakanov
events.wd_description: SBU chief Ivan Bakanov, Zelenskiy's childhood friend, was abruptly fired.
events.description: SBU chief Ivan Bakanov, Zelenskiy's childhood friend, was abruptly fired.

events.name: sacking of Iryna Venediktova
events.wd_description: Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova, who played a key role in prosecuting Russian war crimes, was also abruptly fired.
events.description: Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova, who played a key role in prosecuting Russian war crimes, was also abruptly fired.

events.name: reasons for the sackings
events.wd_description: Over 60 officials from Bakanov's and Venediktova's agencies have started working against Ukraine in Russian-occupied territories, leading to 651 alleged treason cases and collaborations being opened.
events.description: Over 60 officials from Bakanov's and Venediktova's agencies have started working against Ukraine in Russian-occupied territories, leading to 651 alleged treason cases and collaborations being opened.

events.name: Zelenskiy's statement
events.wd_description: President Zelenskiy stated that the crimes against national security by officials pose serious questions to their leaders and vowed to provide proper answers.
events.description: President Zelenskiy stated that the crimes against national security by officials pose serious questions to their leaders and vowed to provide proper answers.

events.name: China accuses the US of sending dangerous signals to Taiwan
events.wd_label: China accuses the US of sending dangerous signals to Taiwan
events.wd_description: China accused the United States of sending "very wrong, dangerous signals" to Taiwan after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told his Chinese counterpart that maintaining peace and stability over Taiwan was vitally important.
events.description: China accused the United States of sending "very wrong, dangerous signals" to Taiwan after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told his Chinese counterpart that maintaining peace and stability over Taiwan was vitally important.

events.name: Blinken's statement
events.wd_description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi that maintaining peace and stability over Taiwan was vitally important.
events.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi that maintaining peace and stability over Taiwan was vitally important.

events.name: China’s accusation
events.wd_description: China accused the United States of sending "very wrong, dangerous signals" to Taiwan following Blinken's statement.
events.description: China accused the United States of sending "very wrong, dangerous signals" to Taiwan following Blinken's statement.

events.name: details of the meeting
events.wd_description: US officials reported that the 90-minute talks between Blinken and Wang Yi focused on Taiwan and were direct and honest, taking place on the margins of the UN General Assembly in New York.
events.description: US officials reported that the 90-minute talks between Blinken and Wang Yi focused on Taiwan and were direct and honest, taking place on the margins of the UN General Assembly in New York.

events.name: China’s stance on Taiwan
events.wd_description: The Chinese Foreign Ministry reiterated that the Taiwan issue is an internal Chinese matter and stated that the United States has no right to interfere in how it is resolved.
events.description: The Chinese Foreign Ministry reiterated that the Taiwan issue is an internal Chinese matter and stated that the United States has no right to interfere in how it is resolved.

events.name: CATL and FlexGen Partnership for Energy Storage
events.wd_label: CATL and FlexGen Partnership for Energy Storage
events.wd_description: On September 21, CATL announced a partnership with FlexGen to supply 10GWh of advanced energy storage products over three years.
events.description: On September 21, CATL announced a partnership with FlexGen to supply 10GWh of advanced energy storage products over three years.

events.name: Supply Agreement Announcement
events.wd_description: CATL and FlexGen signed a partnership agreement for CATL to supply 10GWh of energy storage products over three years.
events.description: CATL and FlexGen signed a partnership agreement for CATL to supply 10GWh of energy storage products over three years.

events.name: Product Details
events.wd_description: CATL will supply FlexGen with containerized liquid-cooled energy storage products, EnerC, which feature IP55 protection and C5 anti-corrosion ratings, suitable for extreme weather and designed for 20 years of reliable operation.
events.description: CATL will supply FlexGen with containerized liquid-cooled energy storage products, EnerC, which feature IP55 protection and C5 anti-corrosion ratings, suitable for extreme weather and designed for 20 years of reliable operation.

events.name: FlexGen's Role
events.wd_description: FlexGen will integrate CATL's energy storage systems with its HybridOS™ energy management platform to provide advanced and reliable energy solutions for utilities, competitive power markets, and municipal projects across North America.
events.description: FlexGen will integrate CATL's energy storage systems with its HybridOS™ energy management platform to provide advanced and reliable energy solutions for utilities, competitive power markets, and municipal projects across North America.

events.name: Market Impact
events.wd_description: This partnership expands CATL's service network in North America and accelerates the development of energy storage projects, contributing to the energy transition and enhancing grid resilience.
events.description: This partnership expands CATL's service network in North America and accelerates the development of energy storage projects, contributing to the energy transition and enhancing grid resilience.

events.name: t: Previous Collaboration
events.wd_description: CATL and FlexGen have collaborated on energy storage projects totaling over 2.5GWh, with FlexGen recently designated as an authorized service provider for CATL's battery storage systems.
events.description: CATL and FlexGen have collaborated on energy storage projects totaling over 2.5GWh, with FlexGen recently designated as an authorized service provider for CATL's battery storage systems.

events.name: t: Industry Prospects
events.wd_description: The energy storage industry holds vast potential for promoting energy transition and improving grid resilience, with CATL playing a leading role in global energy storage innovation.
events.description: The energy storage industry holds vast potential for promoting energy transition and improving grid resilience, with CATL playing a leading role in global energy storage innovation.
